author: S Anil Radhakrishnan
text:
Taking a tough stand on the February 5 flash strike by a section of the Travelling Ticket Examiners (TTE) and other railway personnel at the Thiruvananthapurm Central railway station, the Railways have charge sheeted over 45 personnel, 99 per cent of them TTEs.

Of those facing disciplinary action under the Railway Servants (Discipline & Appeal) Rules, 1968, four have been served with major charge sheet memorandums and 42 with minor charge sheet memorandums by the Commercial Department of the Thiruvananthapuram railway division.

A top railway official told The Hindu that the process to issue the charge sheet to another four personnel in Kollam and Kayankulam was on.

Two employees of the mechanical, one each from the accounts and personnel departments also face disciplinary action for severing electrical connection and disrupting the working of the reservation wing. “
title: 45 rail staff charge sheeted for going on flash strike
